DataElement.preferredName: Cardiac Condition Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) Less Than 50 Percent Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable indicator that describes if patient has left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) less than 50%.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cardiac Condition Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) Less Than 50 Percent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart._A state of being, such as a state of health._The fraction of the left ventricular end diastolic volume ejected with each beat. The left ventricular ejection fraction is equal to the left ventricular stroke volume divided by the left ventricular end diastolic volume._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::50_A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart.:A state of being, such as a state of health.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the heart.
A state of being, such as a state of health.

Property.preferredName: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Less Than Integer::50 Percent Unit
Property.preferredDefinition: The fraction of the left ventricular end diastolic volume ejected with each beat. The left ventricular ejection fraction is equal to the left ventricular stroke volume divided by the left ventricular end diastolic volume.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::50:A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).

Concepts.definition: The fraction of the left ventricular end diastolic volume ejected with each beat. The left ventricular ejection fraction is equal to the left ventricular stroke volume divided by the left ventricular end diastolic volume.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have reduced left ventricular ejection fraction (less than 50%) or other evidence of cardiac dysfunction as determined by the investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Known left ventricular ejecti
ReferenceDocuments.description: Known left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) less than 50%.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction less than or equal to 50% as demonstrated by echocardiogram or MUGA?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have ejection fraction of < 50% by radionuclide angiogram or echocardiogram?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction less than 50% as demonstrated by echocardiogram or MUGA?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) <50%, regardless of whether there are symptoms of heart failure?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had previous moderate or severe impairment of left ventricular systolic function (LVEF less than 50% on echocardiography or equivalent on Multi-Gated Acquisition Scan [MUGA]) even if full recovery has occurred?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have previous moderate or severe impairment of left ventricular systolic function (LVEF less than 45% on echocardiography or equivalent on Multi-Gated Acquisition Scan [MUGA]) even if full recovery has occurred?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is LVEF below institutional lower limit of normal (LLN) or below 50%, whichever is lower, as determined by echocardiogram or MUGA scan within 4 weeks of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is LVEF below institutional lower limit of normal (LLN) or below 50%, whichever is lower, as determined by echocardiogram or MUGA scan within 4 weeks of cycle 1, day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) less than 50% as assessed by echocardiogram?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) less than 50% as assessed by echocardiogram or radionuclide angiography?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than or equal to 50%?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction less than 50% as determined by either echocardiogram or MUGA?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than or equal to 50% by either an echocardiogram (ECHO) or multigated acquisition (MUGA) scan within 28 days before randomization/enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is LVEF greater than or equal to 50% regardless of the cardiac imaging facility's lower limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a cardiac ejection fraction less than 50% as determined by Echocardiogram or MUGA scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction of 50% or less?

DataElement.changeDescription: 6/24/14 created for Theradex eligibility CRF. jc
